page.title: 08Visit To A Farm
page.content: A group of us visited a local farm in our area and questioned the farmer,Mr. Bowman.He told us that he owned 100 acres of land and that his farm was a dairy farm.He has a herd of cows most of which were fresian,but some were crossed with a hereford breed,totaling about 90 cows in all.He told us that the farms in the area were all dairy because the soil was very poor.He said that the only thing which is grown is hay because there is not enough topsoil to grow good crops and under the topsoil it is heavy clay. His day begins at 6-00 a.m. when they milk the cows.They finish about 8-00 a.m. ,then have breakfast.During the rest of the morning they do jobs in the fields such as mending fences or cutting hay.After lunch they carry on with the field jobs until they milk the cows again at tea time.
